paragraphs.text:
%md
###DataFrame Generation###
Problem: resolve the data on hourly level
Idea: use a sliding window and move the window according to the wished length of hours
- Get rid of the json format in the weather hourly data
- Prepare and add hourly usage of a given station
- Merge weather and usage to one DF
- Resolve `null` values

msg.data:
DataFrame Generation

Problem: resolve the data on hourly level
Idea: use a sliding window and move the window according to the wished length of hours

  • Get rid of the json format in the weather hourly data
  • Prepare and add hourly usage of a given station
  • Merge weather and usage to one DF
  • Resolve null values

paragraphs.text:
%sh
d_name=/user/hadoop/
f_name="test"
hdfs dfs -count $d_name
a=0
for i in $(hdfs dfs -ls $d_name)
do
 let "a += 1"
 #echo $a
 echo "Räume auf..."
 hdfs dfs -rm -r $d_name$f_name$a
done
echo $d_name

paragraphs.text:
%sh

# Remove old dataset if already exists in hadoop /user/hadoop directory
d_name=/user/hadoop/usage-stats/

hdfs dfs -test -d $d_name
    if [ $? != 0 ]
            then
                echo "Move folder to HDFS..."
                hdfs dfs -put /home/hadoop/TFL_Cycling_Data_raw/usage-stats /user/hadoop/usage-stats
                echo "Folder successfully uploaded to HDFS"
                hdfs dfs -ls $d_name
            else
                echo "Directory already present in HDFS"
                echo "Move folder to trash"
                hdfs dfs -rm -r -skipTrash $d_name
                echo "$d_name" "has been deleted"
    fi

Jumping Window

First approach, to use a jumping window going from “today” x hours into past and future

%spark2.pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import from_json
from pyspark.sql.types import IntegerType
from pyspark.sql.functions import unix_timestamp, hour, col, split, round
from pyspark.sql.types import *
import pyspark.sql.functions as F

def generateWeatherDF(x):
    """ Generates dataframe on hourly granularity """

    schema_hum = ArrayType(
        StructType([StructField("time", StringType(), True), 
                StructField("humidity", FloatType(), True)]))
        
    schema_temp = ArrayType(
        StructType([StructField("time", StringType(), True), 
                StructField("apparentTemperature", FloatType(), True)]))
        
    schema_wind = ArrayType(
        StructType([StructField("time", StringType(), True), 
                StructField("windSpeed", FloatType(), True)]))
                
    schema_sum = ArrayType(
        StructType([StructField("time", StringType(), True), 
                StructField("icon", StringType(), True)]))
   

    #adding past data from previous day
    rdd_weather = spark.read.csv("/user/hadoop/weather_new.csv", header=True, sep=",")
    columns_to_drop = ["Hourly Weather",
                       "Humidity",
                       "Yesterday",
                       "Daily Weather",
                       "Apparent Temperature (Avg)",
                       "Windspeed"]
                       
    if x > 24:
        y = 0
        i = 0
        b = False
        
        rdd_weather2 = spark.read.csv("/user/hadoop/weather_new.csv", header=True, sep=",")
        
        for j in range(x):
      #      print("Day ", j)
            rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn('Start Date',F.to_date("Start Date", 'dd.MM.yyyy')) 
            #check for -y 
       #     print("Y", y)
            rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn('Yesterday'+`j`, F.date_add(rdd_weather['Start Date'], y))
            rdd_weather2 = rdd_weather2.withColumn('Start Date',F.to_date("Start Date", 'dd.MM.yyyy'))
            rdd_weather = rdd_weather.alias("t").join(rdd_weather2, rdd_weather["Yesterday"+`j`] == rdd_weather2["Start Date"], how='left_outer').select("t.*", rdd_weather2["Start Date"].alias("Start Date"+`j`), rdd_weather2["Hourly Weather"].alias("Hourly Weather"+`j`))
            
            columns_to_drop.append("Hourly Weather"+`j`)
            columns_to_drop.append("Start Date"+`j`)
            columns_to_drop.append("Yesterday"+`j`)

                
            # alt -> neu oder von neu -> alt
            if (x > 24):
                x -= 24
                if (b == False):
                    for k in range(24):
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "sum")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"], schema_sum)[k].getItem("icon"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "hum")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"], schema_hum)[k].getItem("humidity"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "temp")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"], schema_temp)[k].getItem("apparentTemperature"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "wind")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"], schema_wind)[k].getItem("windSpeed"))
                        i += 1
                    b = True
                else:
                    for k in range(24):
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "sum")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"+`j`], schema_sum)[k].getItem("icon"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "hum")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"+`j`], schema_hum)[k].getItem("humidity"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "temp")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"+`j`], schema_temp)[k].getItem("apparentTemperature"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "wind")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"+`j`], schema_wind)[k].getItem("windSpeed"))
                        i += 1
            else:
                for k in range(x):
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "sum")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"+`j`], schema_sum)[k].getItem("icon"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "hum")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"+`j`], schema_hum)[k].getItem("humidity"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "temp")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"+`j`], schema_temp)[k].getItem("apparentTemperature"))
                        rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "wind")+`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"+`j`], schema_wind)[k].getItem("windSpeed"))
                        i += 1
                x = 0
                break
                
            y -= 1

    elif x <= 24 and x >= 0:
        for i in range(x):
            rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "sum") +`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"], schema_sum)[i].getItem("icon"))
        for i in range(x):
            rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "hum") +`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"], schema_hum)[i].getItem("humidity"))
        for i in range(x):
            rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "temp") +`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"], schema_temp)[i].getItem("apparentTemperature"))
        for i in range(x):
            rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn(colChecker(i, "wind") +`i`, from_json(rdd_weather["Hourly Weather"], schema_wind)[i].getItem("windSpeed"))

    else:
        print("Invalid value")
     
    rdd_weather = rdd_weather[sorted(rdd_weather.columns)]
 #   rdd_weather = rdd_weather.drop(*columns_to_drop)
  #  rdd_weather.printSchema()
    rdd_weather = rdd_weather.withColumn('Start Date',F.to_date("Start Date", 'dd.MM.yyyy'))
    
    return rdd_weather
    
def colChecker(i, val):
    """Checks the columns for correct ordering"""
    if (i >= 10):
        if (val == "sum"):
            return "sum"
        elif (val == "hum"):
            return "hum"
        elif (val == "temp"):
            return "temp"
        elif (val == "wind"):
            return "wind"
    else:
        if (val == "sum"):
            return "sum0"
        elif (val == "hum"):
            return "hum0"
        elif (val == "temp"):
            return "temp0"
        elif (val == "wind"):
            return "wind0"
            

def generateRentalDF(station): 
    """Generate cycling usage DF of either all stations or only one station"""
    
    df_usage = spark.read.csv("/user/hadoop/usage-stats/*.csv", header=True)
    df_usage = df_usage.na.fill(0)
    
    #One station, TODO:// all stations
    df_usage = df_usage.filter(col("StartStation Id").isin([''+`station`]))
    
    df_usage.dropna(subset=["StartStation Id", "EndStation Id", "Start Date", "End Date"])

    #Change column types of ID columns
    df_usage = df_usage.withColumn("EndStation ID", df_usage["EndStation ID"].cast("int"))
    df_usage = df_usage.withColumn("StartStation ID", df_usage["StartStation ID"].cast("int"))

    #Prevent StartStation ID = EndStation ID
   # df_usage = df_usage[df_usage["StartStation Id"] != df_usage["EndStation Id"]]

    #Keep only relevant columns
    df_usage = df_usage["Start Date", "StartStation Id", "End Date", "EndStation Id", "Duration"]
    
    #root |-- Start Date: string (nullable = true) |-- StartStation Id: integer (nullable = true) |-- End Date: string (nullable = true) |-- EndStation Id: integer (nullable = true) |-- Duration: string (nullable = true)
    #Add hour column, rounded
    df_usage = df_usage.alias("t").select('t.*', unix_timestamp('Start Date', "dd/MM/yyyy HH:mm").cast(TimestampType()).alias("Timestamp"))
    #df_usage = df_usage.withColumn("Rounded Hour", hour((round(unix_timestamp("Timestamp")/3600)*3600).cast("Timestamp")))
    #change: round off hour values 23:34 -> 23:00
    df_usage = df_usage.withColumn("Rounded Hour", hour(unix_timestamp("Timestamp").cast("Timestamp")))

    
    #Preparing for join
    split_col = split(df_usage['Start Date'], ' ')
    df_usage = df_usage.withColumn('Datum', split_col.getItem(0)).withColumn('Hour', split_col.getItem(1))
    
    #Drop unuseful columns
    columns_to_drop = ["End Date",
                       "EndStation Id",
                       "Duration"
                      # "Start Date",
                      # "StartStation Id"
                       ]
    df_usage = df_usage.drop(*columns_to_drop)


    return df_usage
    

def generatePast(x, df_usage):
    """Generate past hourly data"""
    rm_cols = []
    b = False
    df_usage = df_usage.groupby(df_usage.Datum).pivot("Rounded Hour").count().orderBy("Datum")
    df_usage = df_usage.na.fill(0)
    df_usage = df_usage.alias("t").select('t.*', unix_timestamp('Datum', "dd/MM/yyyy").cast(TimestampType()).alias("Timestamp")).orderBy("Timestamp")
    df_usage = df_usage.drop("Timestamp", "null")
    df_usage = df_usage.withColumn('Datum',F.to_date("Datum", 'dd/MM/yyyy'))
    df_usage = rename_cols(df_usage, "usage_")
    liste = []
    
    ##Past 
    if x > 24:
        #time delta
        y = 0
        #column counter
        i = 24
        for j in range(x):
            liste = []
            print("Past ", j)
            df_usage = df_usage.withColumn('Yesterday'+`j`, F.date_add(df_usage['Datum'], y))
            if (x > 24):
                x -= 24
                if (b == True):
                    for k in range(24):
                        liste.append("usage_"+`i`)
                        i += 1
                    df_usage = df_usage.alias('l').join(df_usage.alias('r'), col('l.Yesterday'+`j`) == col('r.Datum'), how='left').select([col('l.*')] + [col('r.'+"usage_"+`a`).alias(`b`) for a, b in enumerate(liste)])
                b = True
            else:
                for k in range(x):
                    liste.append("usage_"+`i`)
                    i += 1
                df_usage = df_usage.alias('l').join(df_usage.alias('r'), col('l.Yesterday'+`j`) == col('r.Datum'), how='left').select([col('l.*')] + [col('r.'+"usage_"+`a`).alias(`b`) for a, b in enumerate(liste)])
                x = 0
                break
            y -= 1
    
    else:
        for i in range(24, x, -1):
            rm_cols.append("usage_"+`i`)
            rm_cols.append("Yesterday"+`i`) #disable this for previous date
        df_usage = df_usage.drop(*rm_cols)
    
    
    df_usage = df_usage.orderBy("Datum")
    return df_usage

def generateFuture(f, df_usage):
    """Generate future hourly data"""
    ##Future
    y = 0
    i = 0
    rm_cols = []
    for j in range(f):
        print("Future ", j)
        liste = []
        y += 1
        df_usage = df_usage.withColumn('Tomorrow'+`j`, F.date_add(df_usage['Datum'], y))
        if f > 24:
            f -= 24
            for k in range(24):
                liste.append("future_"+`i`)
                i += 1
            df_usage = df_usage.alias('l').join(df_usage.alias('r'), col('l.Tomorrow'+`j`) == col('r.Datum'), how='left').select([col('l.*')] + [col('r.'+ "usage_"+`a`).alias(`b`) for a, b in enumerate(liste)])
        else:
            for k in range(f):
                liste.append("future_"+`i`)
                i += 1
            df_usage = df_usage.alias('l').join(df_usage.alias('r'), col('l.Tomorrow'+`j`) == col('r.Datum'), how='left').select([col('l.*')] + [col('r.'+"usage_"+`a`).alias(`b`) for a, b in enumerate(liste)])
            break
        
    df_usage = df_usage.orderBy("Datum")
    return df_usage
    
def rename_cols(rename_df, z):
    """Rename all frequency columns"""
    for column in rename_df.columns[1:]:
        new_column = z+column 
        rename_df = rename_df.withColumnRenamed(column, new_column)
    return rename_df
    
def cleansingDF(df_rental, df_weather):
    """Cleaning null values, merge weather and usage"""
    df_final = df_rental.alias('l').join(df_weather.alias('r'), col('l.Datum') == col('r.Start Date'), how='left').select(col('l.*'), col('r.*'))
    df_final = df_final.orderBy("Datum")
    return df_final



######Jumping Window Solution######
######For using, just comment out below######
######Note: some functions of this script is reused for sliding window approach below as well#######

####Init
#Set value x = hours to the past, station = station number, f = zielgröße (future)
x = 48
station = 835 #Kings cross = 14 (most used station), Farringdon Street, Holborn = 835 (least used station because it is a new station)
f = 24

####Generate Weather DF

#df_weather.show()

####Generate Rental DF
df_rental = generateRentalDF(station)

When a row has less than 4 empty values than use linear interpolation otherwise use last valid value.

%spark2.pyspark
import pandas as pd 
pd.set_option('display.max_rows', 1000)
pd.set_option('display.max_columns', 1000)
pd.set_option('display.width', 1000)

#generate weather data frame
df_weather = generateWeatherDF(24)
df_weather = df_weather.drop("Hourly Weather")
# Since only 1562 rows, we can convert into a pandas df
df = df_weather.toPandas()  

def replacerNaN(p):
    """Replaces NaN"""
    # interpolation does not work good for larger gaps
    if (p.isnull().sum(axis=0) >= 4):
        p.fillna(method="ffill", inplace=True) #propagate last valid observation forward to next valid 
    return p
    
df = df.apply(lambda x: replacerNaN(x), axis=1)

#linear interpolation of remaining NaNs and round up
df = df.round(2)
df.interpolate(inplace=True)
#df[df.isnull().any(axis=1)]


#substitute hourly summaries with number values
def replacerText(p):
    """Replaces summaries""" 
    cleanup_nums =  {p.name: { "clear-day": 1, "partly-cloudy-day": 2, "cloudy":3, "wind":4, "rain": 5, "fog": 6, "snow": 7, "partly-cloudy-night": 8, "clear-night": 9, "sleet": 10} }
    df.replace(cleanup_nums, inplace=True)
    return df[p.name]

df = df.apply(lambda column: replacerText(column) if "sum" in column.name else column, axis=0)

print(df.iloc[1535])

#convert back to pyspark df 
df_weather = spark.createDataFrame(df)
df_weather.count()

paragraphs.text:
%md
#### Each hour one line ####
> <sup>Transform the `df_usage` dataframe so that each row represents one rounded hour.</sup>

msg.data:
Each hour one line

Transform the df_usage dataframe so that each row represents one rounded hour.

paragraphs.text:
%spark2.pyspark
#Previous solution with pivot tables
old_df = generateRentalDF(station)
old_df = old_df.groupby(old_df.Datum).pivot("Rounded Hour").count().orderBy("Datum")
old_df = old_df.na.fill(0)
old_df = old_df.alias("t").select('t.*', unix_timestamp('Datum', "dd/MM/yyyy").cast(TimestampType()).alias("Timestamp")).orderBy("Timestamp")
old_df.show()

%spark2.pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import concat, col, lit

#Give me all station records from selected station
new_df = generateRentalDF(station)
new_df = new_df.dropna()

#Concatenate daily date column with rounded hour column
new_df = new_df.withColumn("New Datum", concat(col("Datum"), lit(" "), col("Rounded Hour")))
new_df = new_df.alias("t").select('t.*', unix_timestamp('New Datum', "dd/MM/yyyy HH").cast(TimestampType()).alias("New Date")).orderBy("New Date") 
new_df.show()

%spark2.pyspark
#count usage per hour and join back
df_tmp = new_df.groupBy("New Date").count().withColumnRenamed('count', 'Current Usage')
new_df = new_df.join(df_tmp, ["New Date"], "leftouter")
new_df = new_df.drop_duplicates(["New Date"]).orderBy("New Date")
new_df.printSchema()
new_df.show()

%spark2.pyspark
#fill empty or missing hours with 0, supplement missing hours (e.g. 1, 8 -> supplement 2,3,4...)
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, min as min_, max as max_

step = 60 * 60

minp, maxp = new_df.select(
    min_("New Date").cast("long"), max_("New Date").cast("long")
).first()

reference = spark.range(
    (minp / step) * step, ((maxp / step) + 1) * step, step
).select(col("id").cast("timestamp").alias("New Date"))

reference = reference.join(new_df, ["New Date"], "leftouter").orderBy("New Date")
reference.show()

%spark2.pyspark
# Remove unused columns
columns_to_drop = ["Start Date", 
                   "Timestamp",
                   "Rounded Hour",
                   "Datum",
                   "Hour",
                   "New Datum"]
                   
reference = reference.drop(*columns_to_drop)
# fill null values
reference = reference.na.fill(station, subset=['StartStation Id'])
reference = reference.na.fill(0, subset=['Current Usage'])
reference.show()

%md
#### Sliding Window ####
> <sup>Use a sliding window on a hourly base with dynamic size to go from current hour to `past` and to `predict` the next 24 hours from the current hour.</sup>

msg.data:
Sliding Window

Use a sliding window on a hourly base with dynamic size to go from current hour to past and to predict the next 24 hours from the current hour.

paragraphs.text:
%spark2.pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import lag, col, lead, first
from pyspark.sql.window import Window


# go x hours back
for i in range(x):
    w = Window().partitionBy().orderBy(col("New Date"))
    reference = reference.select("*", lag("Current Usage", i+1).over(w).alias("Usage"+`i`))

# Aggregate values
if x >= 48:
    marksColumns = []
    z = 24
    r = x - z
    j = x
    t = 1
    if r % 6 == 0:
        for i in range(r):
            marksColumns.append(col('Usage'+`z`))
            z = z + 1
            if t % 6 == 0:
                averageFunc = sum(x for x in marksColumns)/len(marksColumns)
                reference = reference.withColumn('Usage ' + `j` + ' Avg. over 6h', averageFunc)
                j = j + 1
                marksColumns = []
            t = t + 1

# go f hours future
for i in range(f):
    w = Window().partitionBy().orderBy(col("New Date"))
    reference = reference.select("*", lead("Current Usage", i+1).over(w).alias("Future"+`i`))

reference.show()

paragraphs.text: %md Problem: Weather dataframe has totally different structure. Idea: Use the power of `explode` function in PySpark.

msg.data:
Problem: Weather dataframe has totally different structure.
Idea: Use the power of explode function in PySpark.

paragraphs.text:
%spark2.pyspark
weather = generateWeatherDF(2)
weather = weather.drop(*["Apparent Temperature (Avg)", "Daily Weather", "Hourly Weather", "Humidity", "Windspeed"])
weather.show()

%spark2.pyspark
df_weather.show()

%spark2.pyspark
import pyspark.sql.functions as F
from pyspark.sql.functions import lag, col, lead, first
from pyspark.sql.window import Window
from collections import Counter

def _combine(x,y):
    """creates hourly interval for weather df"""
    print(y)
    d = str(x) + ' {}:00:00'.format(y)
    return d

def transformWeatherDF(df, past):
    """add hours on key column and transform columoriented hours to roworiented hours"""
    
    #Remove daily columns
    df = df.drop(*["Apparent Temperature (Avg)", "Daily Weather", "Hourly Weather", "Humidity", "Windspeed"])
    
    #use udf to generate hours on the dates
    combine = F.udf(lambda x,y: _combine(x,y))

    #fetch relevant columns and keep column datatype
    cols_temp, dtypes = zip(*((c, t) for (c, t) in df.dtypes if c not in ['Start Date'] and c.startswith("temp")))
    cols_hum, dtypes2 = zip(*((c, t) for (c, t) in df.dtypes if c not in ['Start Date'] and c.startswith("hum")))
    cols_sum, dtypes2 = zip(*((c, t) for (c, t) in df.dtypes if c not in ['Start Date'] and c.startswith("sum")))
    cols_wind, dtypes2 = zip(*((c, t) for (c, t) in df.dtypes if c not in ['Start Date'] and c.startswith("wind")))
    
    ##temperature
    #explode function for changing structure of dataframe (temperature)
    kvs = F.explode(F.array([
          F.struct(F.lit(c).alias("key"), F.col(c).alias("val")) for c in cols_temp],
          )).alias("kvs")

    df_temp = df.select(['Start Date'] + [kvs])\
       .select(['Start Date'] + ["kvs.key", F.col("kvs.val").alias('Current Temperature')])\
       .withColumn('key', F.regexp_replace('key', 'temp', ''))\
       .withColumn('Start Date', combine('Start Date','key').cast('timestamp'))\
       .drop('key')

    # go x hours back (temperature)
    for i in range(past):
        w = Window().partitionBy().orderBy(col("Start Date"))
        df_temp = df_temp.select("*", lag("Current Temperature", i+1).over(w).alias("temp"+`i`))
        
    # Aggregate temperature values
    if past >= 48:
        marksColumns = []
        z = 24
        r = past - z
        j = past
        t = 1
        if r % 6 == 0:
            for i in range(r):
                marksColumns.append(col('temp'+`z`))
                z = z + 1
                if t % 6 == 0:
                    averageFunc = sum(x for x in marksColumns)/len(marksColumns)
                    df_temp = df_temp.withColumn('temp ' + `j` + ' Avg. over 6h', averageFunc)
                    j = j + 1
                    marksColumns = []
                t = t + 1

    ##humidity
    #explode humidity columns
    kvs = F.explode(F.array([
          F.struct(F.lit(c).alias("key"), F.col(c).alias("val")) for c in cols_hum],
          )).alias("kvs")
      
    df2 = df.select(['Start Date'] + [kvs])\
       .select(['Start Date'] + ["kvs.key", F.col("kvs.val").alias('Current Humidity')])\
       .withColumn('key', F.regexp_replace('key', 'hum', ''))\
       .withColumn('Start Date', combine('Start Date','key').cast('timestamp'))\
       .drop('key')
       
    # go x hours back (humidity)
    for i in range(past):
        w = Window().partitionBy().orderBy(col("Start Date"))
        df2 = df2.select("*", lag("Current Humidity", i+1).over(w).alias("hum"+`i`))
        
    # Aggregate humidity values
    if past >= 48:
        marksColumns = []
        z = 24
        r = past - z
        j = past
        t = 1
        if r % 6 == 0:
            for i in range(r):
                marksColumns.append(col('hum'+`z`))
                z = z + 1
                if t % 6 == 0:
                    averageFunc = sum(x for x in marksColumns)/len(marksColumns)
                    df2 = df2.withColumn('hum ' + `j` + ' Avg. over 6h', averageFunc)
                    j = j + 1
                    marksColumns = []
                t = t + 1
    
    df_temp = df_temp.join(df2, "Start Date", "leftouter").orderBy("Start Date")
    
    ##summary
    #explode summary columns
    kvs = F.explode(F.array([
          F.struct(F.lit(c).alias("key"), F.col(c).alias("val")) for c in cols_sum],
          )).alias("kvs")
      
    df2 = df.select(['Start Date'] + [kvs])\
       .select(['Start Date'] + ["kvs.key", F.col("kvs.val").alias('Current Summary')])\
       .withColumn('key', F.regexp_replace('key', 'sum', ''))\
       .withColumn('Start Date', combine('Start Date','key').cast('timestamp'))\
       .drop('key')
       
    # go x hours back (summary)
    for i in range(past):
        w = Window().partitionBy().orderBy(col("Start Date"))
        df2 = df2.select("*", lag("Current Summary", i+1).over(w).alias("sum"+`i`))
    
    # Aggregate summary values
    if past >= 48:
        marksColumns = []
        z = 24
        r = past - z
        j = past
        t = 1
        if r % 6 == 0:
            for i in range(r):
                marksColumns.append(col('sum'+`z`))
                z = z + 1
                if t % 6 == 0:
                    averageFunc = sum(x for x in marksColumns)/len(marksColumns)
                    df2 = df2.withColumn('sum ' + `j` + ' Avg. over 6h', averageFunc)
                    j = j + 1
                    marksColumns = []
                t = t + 1

    
    df_temp = df_temp.join(df2, "Start Date", "leftouter").orderBy("Start Date")
    
    ##windspeed
    #explode windspeed columns
    kvs = F.explode(F.array([
          F.struct(F.lit(c).alias("key"), F.col(c).alias("val")) for c in cols_wind],
          )).alias("kvs")
      
    df2 = df.select(['Start Date'] + [kvs])\
       .select(['Start Date'] + ["kvs.key", F.col("kvs.val").alias('Current Windspeed')])\
       .withColumn('key', F.regexp_replace('key', 'wind', ''))\
       .withColumn('Start Date', combine('Start Date','key').cast('timestamp'))\
       .drop('key')
       
    # go x hours back (windspeed)
    for i in range(past):
        w = Window().partitionBy().orderBy(col("Start Date"))
        df2 = df2.select("*", lag("Current Windspeed", i+1).over(w).alias("wind"+`i`))
        
    # Aggregate windspeed values
    if past >= 48:
        marksColumns = []
        z = 24
        r = past - z
        j = past
        t = 1
        if r % 6 == 0:
            for i in range(r):
                marksColumns.append(col('wind'+`z`))
                z = z + 1
                if t % 6 == 0:
                    averageFunc = sum(x for x in marksColumns)/len(marksColumns)
                    df2 = df2.withColumn('wind ' + `j` + ' Avg. over 6h', averageFunc)
                    j = j + 1
                    marksColumns = []
                t = t + 1
    
    df_temp = df_temp.join(df2, "Start Date", "leftouter").orderBy("Start Date")

    return df_temp

transformWeatherDF(df_weather, 3).show()

df_weather = transformWeatherDF(df_weather, 48) #Note: For reusing, first execute Interpolation cell above

%spark2.pyspark
df_weather.printSchema()
reference.printSchema()

%spark2.pyspark
from pyspark.sql.functions import to_date, col

##Merge prepared usage frame with prepared weather dataframe
df_final = reference.alias('l').join(df_weather.alias('r'), col('l.New Date') == col('r.Start Date'), how='left').select(col('l.*'), col('r.*'))
df_final = df_final.drop(*["Start Date"])
df_final = df_final.orderBy("New Date")
df_final = df_final.na.fill(0)
df_final.printSchema()

##remove first and last rows according to x
df = df_final.toPandas()
df = df.iloc[x:]
df.drop(df.tail(x).index,inplace=True)
df_final = spark.createDataFrame(df)
